oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from B. J. Semmes, Office Chief of the Depot Commissary, Headquarters, Army of Tennessee, reporting on provisions

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Armies -- Commissariat; Northrop, Lucius Bellinger, 1811-1894
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Officer Chief Depot Com’y Hd Qts Army of Tenn near Chattanooga Oct 6th 1863 Col L. B. Northrop Com’y Gen’l Richmond Va. Sir; Enclosed I have the honor to hand you my Reports for the 3rd Quarter 1863. ending the 30th September – embracing Form #1 Return Provisions with vouchers. Rcpts 1 to 8 Form #12 Return Commissary Property with vouchers Invoices 1 & 2. Receipts 1 to 22. Form #8 Abstract Purchases with vouchers 1 to 18 Form #7 Account Current with Receipts 1 & 2 Form #20 Report of persons and Articles employed &c Very Respectfully B. J. Semmes Capt A.C.S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from B. J. Semmes, Office Chief of the Depot Commissary, Army of Tennessee Headquarters near Chattanooga, reporting to Colonel L. B. Northrop, Commissary General, in Richmond, Virginia, on returns and abstracts of provisions, accounts, contingencies, and purchases during the third quarter of 1863.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Army -- Subsistence Bureau
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Early Confederate Army regulations created the Office of Subsistence to procure subsistence stores for the army through contracts. The Commissary Department was in charge of all food or subsistence supplies at a military post. The storehouses used by the Assistant Commissaries of Subsistence were provided by the Quartermaster's Department.
